ibis.ipl.benchmarks.randomsteal

Class RandomSteal

  • java.lang.Object
    • ibis.ipl.benchmarks.randomsteal.RandomSteal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ibis.ipl.RegistryEventHandler

    public class RandomSteal
extends java.lang.Object
implements ibis.ipl.RegistryEventHandler
    This program is designed to simulate Satins 'worst case behaviour', i.e a storm of steal requests. to be run as two instances. One is a server, the other a client. The client connects to the to the server and (optionally) sends it a number of bytes. The server receives the bytes, connects to the client and returns the bytes it received. By default, a new connection is created for every message. Depending on the command line options, this test uses normal, light, or ultra light messages. This version uses explicit receive.
